briefdescription.para: Shows the features and attributes in a table layout.
Show a list of the features, where one can be chosen and the according attribute dialog will be presented in the neighbouring frame.
The view modes, in which this widget can present information.

The config used for the attribute table.

simplesect.para: The config used for the attribute table.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of features on the layer.

Gets a list of currently visible feature ids.
Gets the filter mode.

briefdescription.para: Has to be called to initialize the dual view.

detaileddescription.para: If enabled, selected features will be moved to top.

parameterdescription.para: True: Show selected features on top. False: Use defined sorting column.

briefdescription.para: Set the current edit selection in the AttributeEditor mode.

parameterdescription.para: A list of edited features (Currently only one at a time is supported)

briefdescription.para: Sets whether multi edit mode is enabled.
Toggles whether search mode should be enabled in the form.

parameterdescription.para: set to true to switch on search mode

briefdescription.para: Is emitted, whenever the display expression is successfully changed.
Is emitted, whenever the filter changes.

parameterdescription.para: feature id of the selected feature

briefdescription.para: Will be called whenever the currently shown feature form changes.

detaileddescription.para: Will forward this signal to the feature list to visually represent that there has been an edit event.

briefdescription.para: Will be called, once all the features are loaded.

detaileddescription.para: Use e.g. to close a dialog created from progress( int i, bool &cancel )

briefdescription.para: Changes the currently visible feature within the attribute editor.
Pans to the active feature.
Will be called periodically, when loading layers from slow data providers.

parameterdescription.para: The number of features already loaded

briefdescription.para: Zooms to the active feature.
Initializes widgets which depend on the attributes of this layer.
This widget is used to show the attributes of a set of features of a QgsVectorLayer.

detaileddescription.para: The attributes can be edited. It supports two different layouts: the table layout, in which the attributes for the features are shown in a table and the editor layout, where the features are shown as a selectable list and the attributes for the currently selected feature are shown in a form.
